statements.query: MATCH (n:RDSCluster)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE n.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH n LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DETACH DELETE (n) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Delete RDS clusters that no longer exist and DETACH them from all nodes they were previously connected to.

statements.query: MATCH (:RDSCluster)<-[r:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: If an RDS cluster still exists but is no longer associated with its old AWS Account, delete the relationship between them.

statements.query: MATCH (:RDSCluster)<-[r:IS_CLUSTER_MEMBER_OF]-(:RDSInstance)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:AWSAccount{id: {AWS_ID}}) WHERE r.lastupdated <> {UPDATE_TAG} WITH r LIMIT {LIMIT_SIZE} DELETE (r) return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: If an RDS instance still exists and is no longer a member of an RDS cluster, delete the relationship between them.
